Comment: The tragic murder of Austin Metcalf, a Texas teen, has become a focal point for some MAGA media outlets, drawing attention for reasons that many see as exploitative and divisive. Rather than focusing on the grief of the local community, certain media channels have used the case to stoke racial tensions and amplify polarized narratives. This has sparked outrage, with critics accusing these outlets of using Metcalf's death to push their own agendas, rather than allowing the community to heal and find justice in a way that respects all individuals involved. The situation has become a powerful example of how media can sometimes tear communities apart, prioritizing sensationalism over sensitivity in the face of tragedy.

Comment: But that’s the problem isn’t it? You say freaks, but the number of people is higher than that comment implies.  Saying both sides do something does not imply equal culpability. Now, maybe I’m too literal of a person. I have been accused of that in the past, but wording matters as it sets the stage for a discussion.

Comment: She’s not defending Anthony or backing his self defence claim though, is she? It’s not an article exonerating the murderer, it’s an article about how a murder is being used and warped by racists to promote a race war, regardless of the facts or the victims family.   That Anthony was immediately regretful and stupidly unaware of the severity of his actions doesn’t have anything to do with a self-defence claim, but it does undermine the fantasy he was a hardened brute out for white blood. The majority of  murderers are stupid boys getting riled up over stupid things, and this was, sadly, a pretty standard murder. The reason she brings up the self-defence claim is that Texas’ stand-your-ground laws, although largely implemented as a way to defend disproportionate racist violence, are Anthony’s only hope of a defence. That’s because they exist to justify over the top violent reactions to perceived threat, such as black kids walking through your neighbourhood. I doubt they will work for Anthony.

Comment: First of all, it's not right conflating leaders and audiences. Are there people across the political spectrum who are thoughtless and cruel? Yes.   But only one side has made that their official culture, and validates that behavior from on top.   Moreover, I doubt we'd see even a fraction of the ill-advised reactions from anon commenters on the left if the MAGA thought leaders hadn't made this a culture war issue. The reason some on the left take it too far is they're seeing all this racist stuff on the right, they start to get angry, and they lose control. It's not justified, but it's also not surprising. MAGA media is meant to provoke reactions while turning off brains. It's not a surprise that its tactics work on people on the left, as well. MAGA media is provoking them. They are provoked. Not shocking.   That's why it's so dangerous to conflate a benign report from CBS News with the unhinged shit you're seeing on Fox. CBS is not deliberately provoking people to turn off their brains and turn on vomitous, defensive emotions.
Author: ProtectionAdditional

Comment: I do, I just don’t like people arguing in bad faith.    I brought up the lawyer, who is standing there with gasoline and match.  https://www.reddit.com/r/texas/s/JEGrJGBrXy  At the same time you can see the comments.   I brought up the minister -That’s his lawyer, no problem.   Which, btw is a problem as he is a self proclaimed activist minister representing an organization specifically in this vein.  Ok, what about all the social media comments -Not a media outlet doesn’t count.  And as I said, pretending like it’s only one group is disingenuous. Maybe the right is making a bigger deal out of it. I don’t really watch any of the right wing media, so I can’t tell you if it’s done more there.  So did I get proven wrong and stomp my feet? No, I just backed away from a discussion where people were going to disregard anything that didn’t fit their pre conceived notions.   Look, everybody had their preconceived ideas, myself included. I will not say that I don’t do it too. If someone starts talking about woke or DEI, I typically shut down what they’re saying as those terms are specifically meant to invalidate a discussion based on a non existent moral high ground.  Had the poster stated than 80% of it was coming from the right, sure, I probably wouldn’t have though much of it. But to say there’s nothing when every comment section on a post about it is like a warzone is not accurate.   It can not be you are always right, and your enemies are always wrong. If you believe that, then you lack self reflection. So, I stand by the statements I provided unless you can provide a convincing alternative opinion.
